install.name: MetaMod
install.author: Stephen Brandon
install.copyright: This extension in released under the GNU/GPL License - http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html
install.description: A module that allows selective inclusion of other modules, depending on time, date, GeoIP-based Country lookup, and any other factors.

param.name: start_datetime
param.label: Start date/time (freeform)
param.description: Start date, time or both for the module to display anything at all. If you specify only a date (not time) then the module will be active from the start of that day. If you enter only a time then that applies every day. Examples: 1 October 2008 09:30 e.g. October 2 2008 e.g. 11:15 e.g. 10:00PM

param.name: end_datetime
param.label: End date/time (freeform)
param.description: End date, time or both for the module to display anything at all. If you specify only a date (not time) then the module will be active up until the START of the specified day. So you might want to specify 1 day later so that it runs until midnight. If you enter only a time then that applies every day. Examples: 1 October 2008 09:30 e.g. October 2 2008 e.g. 11:15 e.g. 10:00PM

param.name: debug
param.label: Debug
param.description: Print debug information before included modules

param.name: use_geoip
param.label: Enable GeoIP/GeoCity
param.description: Whether or not to try to load the GeoIP country database, look up the client IP address and convert to a 2-letter country code in the $fromCountryId variable.

param.name: include_countries
param.label: Only these countries
param.description: Comma-separated list of 2-letter country abbreviations which will see this module. All other countries will be excluded.

param.name: exclude_countries
param.label: Exclude these countries
param.description: Comma-separated list of 2-letter country abbreviations which will not see this module at all.

param.name: style
param.label: Style for included modules
param.description: How to display any modules included by metamod.
param.option: In a table (default) - uses <th> for title
Multiple divs (for rounded corners) - uses <h3> for title
XHTML - in div, uses <h3> for title

param.name: module_ids
param.label: Quick module id include
param.description: Comma-separated list of modules ids that will always be included, subject to date and GeoIP conditions above. These modules will be included BEFORE any returned from the PHP code below.

param.name: php
param.label: PHP
param.description: PHP code to determine the module number to display. To tell MetaMod to use a particular module or set of modules, return a single module id, comma-separated string of ids, or an array of module ids. More help below.
